comment.body: Good luck bro! But I think the best idea is to have a nice slow Christmas eve by yourself and then try to get out to meet some people at international pubs at like the 25/26.
Also check with r/Stockholmsocialclub who may be up to something.

What part of Stockholm are you staying in? Sorry about the lack of snow. If you take the train for the day just a little north to Uppsala, there might still be a little snow there. There was on Saturday at least. They have a nice river through town and huge church you can tour for free.

Christmas is family only in Sweden, even inviting friends is considered absurd.
If you happen to find someone who will invite a stranger to their Christmas celebration, they most likely have some ulterior motive (like recruiting you into a religious cult).
Thanks - lines up with what I read online, might resort to that :)
In Nacka - but that is a good tip, will keep that in mind! Thanks

This is definitely not how it is.


But as a complete stranger to be invited yeah that is rare.
I suggest posting in local fb groups or perhaps check out Stadsmissionen, know that they have something going in every day
Nah, my family has always (until the last 2 years) taken in lonely people for the holidays. And none of us belongs to any churches or the likes.
Thanks! I have seen some events here and there - might go there (lets see how far this here goes)
